intro: Pimelea traversii subsp. traversii, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Heath, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forest habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is a member of the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper. This subspecies is known for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local wildlife.
